intro: Crepis hyoseridifolia, commonly known as the slender hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Crepis hyoseridifolia is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
